definition: ink marks/original calligraphy or painting of famous person
ink stick/China ink/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/corporal punishment consisting of tattooing characters on the victim's forehead
surname Mo/abbr. for 墨西哥[Mo4 xi1 ge1], Mexico

sentences.english: Her exercise-book is stained with ink marks.
sentences.chinese: 她的練習本上沾了墨跡。

sentences.english: The fugacious past destined to be my single vermilion mark.
sentences.chinese: 飄渺前塵，註定只成爲我一個人的硃砂墨跡。

sentences.english: The shiniest calligraphy in the garden is of course Yubei Pavilion beside Xiyan Pond.
sentences.chinese: 園中最搶眼的墨跡，自然是洗硯池旁邊的御碑亭。

sentences.english: These ink stains won't wash out.
Perhaps I've toyed with you long enough.
sentences.chinese: 現在我沒有時間和你墨跡了。

sentences.english: Blot your letter before folding it.
sentences.chinese: 折信前，你先把信上的墨跡吸乾。

sentences.english: If it is not read, it is nothing more than inkblot on paper.
sentences.chinese: 如果不去閱讀它，它僅僅是紙上的墨跡而已。

sentences.english: Javert dried the fresh ink on the paper.
Wenger, though, maintains until the ink is dry, no deal can be considered done.
sentences.chinese: 溫格還認爲，直到墨跡未乾，沒有交易可視爲完成。

sentences.english: He smudged the ink with his hand.
sentences.chinese: 他用手把墨跡弄模糊了。

sentences.english: He had not wanted to smudge the creamy paper by shutting the book while the ink was wet.
sentences.chinese: 他不願在墨跡未乾之前就合上本子弄污乳白的紙張。

sentences.english: The inkblot protests A new generation takes to the barricades.
sentences.chinese: 墨跡抗議一個新的一代的路障。

sentences.english: A drop of ink spreads on the paper.
sentences.chinese: 一滴墨水在紙上形成了一片墨跡。

definition: to copy (a model of calligraphy or painting etc)
authentic (painting or calligraphy)/genuine work (of famous artist)
to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]
to inscribe a poem (often, composed on the spot) on a painting, fan or ceramic bowl etc as a work of calligraphy/an inscribed poem
to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
